stem: Given question: Where does litter end up when it's tossed from a car? and answer: roadsides, explain why in
no_more_50_words: If one was to toss garbage from a moving car, because the car is likely to be driving along a road, the trash would likely end up a few feet away on the road side.
50_to_100_words: Litter that is tossed from a car typically ends up on roadsides because it is not properly disposed of and the wind or momentum of the car can cause it to fly out of the window. Additionally, many people carelessly throw trash out of their car windows without considering the impact it will have on the environment. The accumulation of litter on roadsides not only unsightly but also harmful to wildlife and can be dangerous for other people using the road.
